resources.string: Lock delay time mode
Lock delay enforcement. 1 means immediately, 2 means one minute, 3 means five minutes, 4 means thirty minutes and anything else means user criteria
Server URL
The server URL that will appear in the login screen by default
Server URL visibility
Indicates whether the input field for the server URL in the login screen is visible or not
Allow screenshots
Enables or disables the possibility to allow screenshots or not
OpenID Connect scope
Indicates the scope for OpenID Connect
App security forced when device not protected
Indicates if the app security when device is not protected is forced
Redact authorization header in HTTP logs

Indicates whether the sensitive information in the authorization header in HTTP requests is hidden in logs or not (NOTE: if logs are already enabled, they must be disabled and re-enabled for this option to work properly)
Send login_hint and user parameters
Indicates whether the login requests contain login_hint and user parameters to show a value in the username text field
The lock delay was set correctly
The server URL was set correctly
The URL input visibility was set correctly
The preference for allowing screenshots was set correctly
The OpenID Connect scope was set correctly
The OpenID Connect prompt was set correctly
The app security forced when device not protected was set correctly
The preference for redacting auth header in logs was set correctly
The preference for sending login_hint and user as parameters was set correctly
